title.native: 小林さんちのメイドラゴン

description:
What happens when a drunken promise leads to living with a dragon? That’s Miss Kobayashi’s new reality when Tohru appears in her life. With a maid-slash-dragon in her home, she’s experiencing a whole new level of domestic bliss! But the dragons don’t stop there. On a mission to find Tohru appears Kanna, a little dragon with a big attitude. Before she knows it, Kobayashi’s got a house full of dragons—one serving tail and the other serving serious moe! Together, they live side by side with only the occasional disaster…well, maybe. But nothing beats coming home to the warm welcome of a dragon maid!

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: น้องเมดมังกรของคุณโคบายาชิ

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Office Lady
tags.description: Prominently features a female office worker or OL.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Software Development
tags.description: Centers around characters developing or programming a piece of technology, software, gaming, etc.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description:
Yasuhiro Takemoto studied animation at the Yoyogi Animation Academy. After graduating, he started working at [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/Kyoto-Animation) for almost his entire animation career, joining the company in 1996. At the company, Yasuhiro was considered one of the most reliable and trustworthy members of the staff. [Nurse Witch Komugi](https://anilist.co/anime/615/Nurse-Witch-Komugichan/) was his directorial debut​ and [Full Metal Panic? Fumoffu](https://anilist.co/anime/72/Full-Metal-Panic-Fumoffu/) his first solo directorial debut.

He died in the arson attack at Kyoto Animation's Studio 1 on July 18, 2019.

Masumi Itou is a singer and composer. Ito has composed the soundtracks to many anime television shows and is part of the bands Oranges & Lemons and Heart of Air. She graduated from Musashino College of Music, and her husband is music producer Yoshiyuki Ito.

Mikiko Watanabe was a background artist and art director affiliated with Kyoto Animation.

She tragically lost her life alongside 34 colleagues in the Kyoto Animation arson attack on July 18, 2019.
Animator and character designer affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

A four-member Japanese pop band that formed in 2012 as an indie band. After releasing one album independently, they were signed in 2013 to Lantis. They released their debut single "Que Sera Sera" in August 2013. 

Fhána originally formed with [Junichi Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/127344), Yuxuki Waga and Kevin Mitsunaga, and all three had previously been involved in separate indie bands. Fhána did not have a fixed vocalist at first, instead employing guest vocalists to sing the band's songs. Fhána released their independent album New World Line on May 18, 2012 featuring four guest vocalists: Makiko Naka, Towana, IA, and Aoi Tada. In late 2012, Towana joined Fhána as the official vocalist. Fhána was signed to Lantis in 2013 and released their major debut single "Que Sera Sera" on August 21, 2013; the song is used as the ending theme to the 2013 anime series The Eccentric Family (Uchouten Kazoku).
Tragically lost her life alongside 34 colleagues in the Kyoto Animation arson attack on July 18, 2019.
Began as a painter at Mushi Production then left and established Kyoto Animation with her husband [Hideaki Hatta](https://anilist.co/staff/107789/Hideaki-Hatta).
Shinichi Nakamura is a producer working for Pony Canyon.
**Masayuki Nishide** is a Japanese producer and animation planner, who works for the Asahi Broadcasting Corporation (ABC).

Co-Founder of Kyoto Animation and husband of producer [Youko Hatta](https://anilist.co/staff/103085/).

Started his career as a painter at Shin-Ei Animation in the early '80s.

**Spouse:** [Masumi Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/103635/Masumi-Itou) (alternatively known as Hikaru Nanase)

**Yoshiyuki Itou** is a Japanese producer, music producer and animation planner. He works as a music producer for the company Lantis.

[Website](https://www.heart-company.co.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Saito_S_HC)

Produces and directs music. Founder of Heart Company.

[Website](https://www.heart-company.co.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Saito_S_HC)

Produces and directs music. Founder of Heart Company.
Founder and representative director of Otonarium.
Tragically lost her life alongside 34 colleagues in the Kyoto Animation arson attack on July 18, 2019.

streamingEpisodes.title: Episode 1 - The Strongest Maid in History, Tohru! (Well, She is a Dragon)
Episode 2 - Second Dragon, Kanna! (We're Totally Spoiling Here)
Episode 3 - Start of a New Life! (That Doesn't Go Well, Of Course)
Episode 4 - Kanna Goes to School! (Not that she needs to.)
Episode 5 - Tohru's Real World Lessons! (She thinks she understands it already.)
Episode 6 - Home Visit! (And Homes Not Visited)
Episode 7 - Summer's Staples! (The Fanservice Episode, Frankly)
Episode 8 - New Dragon, Elma! (She's Finally Appearing, Huh?)
Episode 9 - Sports Festival! (There's No Twist Or Anything)
Episode 10 - Troupe Dragon, On Stage! (They Had A Troupe Name, Huh)
Episode 11 - Year End, New Year! (No Comiket Bit This Time)
Episode 12 - Tohru and Kobayashi's Impactful Meeting! (We're Raising the Bar on Ourselves)
Episode 13 - Emperor of Demise Arrives! (It Was the Final Episode Before We Knew It)
